articles.title: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI): Can It Really Think Like A Human?
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: Artificial general intelligence (AGI) represents artificial intelligence that can understand, learn and apply knowledge in a way that is indistinguishable from human cognition. AGI's potential goes far beyond ANI and could revolutionize healthcare, education, transportation and countless other fields.

articles.title: Zero-Knowledge Proofs Could Hold the Key to Fair and Private AI
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: Zero-knowledge proofs allow AI models to be audited without revealing sensitive data or the internal logic of algorithms. Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning offers a way to verify that systems do not discriminate without sacrificing the security of the data.    .

articles.title: AI Bots: The Future of Customer Service?
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Airbnb has rolled out an AI-powered customer service bot in the U.S. this month. 50% of customers are already interacting with the bot. Competitors like Expedia and Booking.com are also investing heavily in AI to enhance their offerings. Kayak is also jumping into the AI arena.

articles.title: Sevii: Pre-Seed Funding Raised For Autonomous Agentic AI Defense Platform
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Sevii announced the closing of its pre-seed funding round. Overline led the round, which also included 10VC and SaaS Ventures. Sevii's ADR platform deploys an agentic 'army' of AI cyber warriors to manage detections at the edge while also triaging and remediating cyber threats at machine speed.

articles.title: Forum: Human mentorship and AI can make learning meaningful and personalised for children
articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: Opinion piece "Is AI the answer to bridging the tuition gap?" was published on April 30th. We agree with the opinion piece and agree AI is not an answer to the problem of bridging tuition gap but is a solution to it.

articles.title: AI-based imaging and research centre got inaugurated
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: The RADAR centre aims to enhance precision diagnostics through AI-enabled imaging. It aims to improve the accuracy of patient's diagnosis and care by using AI-enableated imaging.    for more information, visit: www.radar-centre.org.

articles.title: NVIDIA Corp. (NVDA): Among Billionaire Chase Coleman's Stocks with Huge Upside Potential
articles.author: Neha Gupta
articles.summary: Billionaire Chase Coleman's Tiger Global Management was one of the best-performing hedge funds after gaining 24% in 2024. He invested his hedge fund's money in some of the top-performing AI stocks. The AI-driven rally is fizzling and the stock market correction is taking its toll on his investments. Morgan Stanley reiterated an Overweight rating on NVIDIA Corp and cut the price target to $160 from $162.

articles.title: AI-authored books about ADHD â€˜for sale on Amazon'
articles.author: Fiona Parker
articles.summary: Amazon allows AI-authored books about ADHD to be sold on its platform. It comes after AI were accused of copying a Holocaust survivor's memoir last week. Amazon has content guidelines governing which books can be listed for sale and it has proactive and reactive methods to detect content that violates them.

articles.title: AI & The Future of Work: Robonnement
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Robonnement is a company dedicated to transforming working conditions through the strategic deployment of robots. Its mission is to democratize robots and create a better workplace. Dr. Anya Sharma believes that AI and robotics can relieve employees of repetitive, perilous, or tedious tasks and free up human workers to focus on creative and strategic roles.

articles.title: MSI Prestige 13 AI+ Evo A2VM
articles.summary: MSI's Prestige 13 AI+ Evo A2VM laptop starts at $1,399.99. PCMag editors select and review products independently. If you buy through affiliate links, we may earn commissions, which help support our testing. MSI's marketing materials bill the Prestige as "the peak of AI-ready PC laptops".

articles.title: AI-Authored ADHD Books: Amazon Danger
articles.author: The Surge
articles.summary: There is a surge of AI-authored health and ADHD guides on Amazon. Richard Wordsworth was recently diagnosed with ADHD and received a book recommendation from his father. The book was written by an AI chatbot. Amazon's business model incentivizes the publication of such guides. There are no regulations governing AI-generated content on online marketplaces.

articles.title: Fake Firm Staffed With Bots Was a 'Total Disaster'
articles.author: Jenn Gidman
articles.summary: Researchers at Carnegie Mellon created a virtual simulation of a software company staffed entirely by artificial intelligence "agents" from companies such as OpenAI, Google, Meta, Amazon, and Anthropic. The results of the experiment were a "total disaster" for Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet. Amazon's Nova Pro 1.0 finished only 1.7% of its tasks.

articles.title: SC State STEM Showcase highlights student innovation and research excellence
articles.author: South Carolina
articles.summary: Nancy Kasamala, a graduate student at South Carolina State University, presented her research at the university's annual STEM Showcase. She is developing a hybrid detection model that merges convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and transformers to improve object recognition even when scooters are partially hidden.

articles.title: Prediction: This Will Be the Top-Performing Semiconductor Stock Over the Next 10 Years (Hint: It's Not Nvidia)
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing is a key partner to chipmakers as they rely on the company's foundry services. The launch of ChatGPT on Nov. 30, 2022 was one of the leading catalysts that sparked the revolution around artificial intelligence (AI). Since that date, shares of semiconductor stock Nvidia have soared an astronomical 550%, transforming the company to a multitrillion-dollar enterprise. Taiwan Semi's growth prospects are the best in at least the last decade, but its valuation is unchanged from its 10-year average.

articles.title: PNNL researchers advance use of AI to ultimately accelerate scientific discovery
articles.author: Steven Ashby
articles.summary: Steven Ashby is director of the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory in Richland, Wash. PNNL is developing a proof-in-concept agent-based platform that incorporates different commercially available AI models and several tools to accelerate innovation in an area of chemistry known as catalysis.

articles.title: Google trains AI products with content after publishers opt out, Bloomberg says
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Google can train its search-specific AI products on content across the web even if publishers opt out. Google's controls for publishers to opt out of AI training covers works by Google DeepMind, but other organizations at the company can further train the models for their products.

articles.title: The great cognitive migration: How AI is reshaping human purpose, work and meaning
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Humans need to embrace domains where AI still falters. Human creativity, ethics and emotion are indispensable for AI development, says KPMG's chief executive officer, Mark Kuznetsov. Kuznetsvskonkonkoff: "Humans should embrace domains in which AI falters, and where human creativity and ethics are indispensable."

articles.title: UAE Integrates AI into School Curriculum for Future Readiness
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates is set to launch artificial intelligence as a core element of its public school curriculum later this year. It is a significant step towards integrating cutting-edge technologies into education. This is according to a report in the Arab Post. The report is based on information from the report.

articles.title: AI Is Changing Branding. Here's How To Protect Your Trademark
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: As AI accelerates content creation, trademarking is no longer optional. Rosezena J. Pierce advises on how to protect your IP from expert attorney Rosezenia J. P. Pierce. She is an expert in trademarking matters.   Ã‚

articles.title: CII Launches Guidebook On AI Governance For Board Leaders
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) released a new guidebook to Artificial Intelligence (AI) on Sunday. CII believes AI is becoming a key part of modern businesses and is releasing a guidebook on AI for business purposes. Â

articles.title: AI-created Churchill retells Starmer who demolished Nazi Germany in WWII
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: RT has released an AI-generated video featuring former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill. Churchill emphasizes the critical role of the Soviet Union in the defeat of Nazi Germany.  Â     in which he emphasizes the importance of Soviet Union's role in World War II's defeat.

articles.title: Perplexed by Lies on WhatsApp? Perplexity AI Can Now Fact Check Within the App.
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: WhatsApp has integrated an AI tool into the app to help quickly sort the fakery from the truth from the most dangerous misinfo. The tool is called Perplexity AI and it's available to anyone. It's not perfect but it's preferable to letting misinformation run rampant.

articles.title: These Are the Top Ways Men Are Frustrated by Modern Dating
articles.author: Jessica McBride
articles.summary: Joi AI conducted a survey of 2,000 men on modern dating. Two-thirds of men said their conversations rarely or never turn into real dates when using dating apps. According to Joi AI, 41% of men believe dating apps are a 'scam' and 76% are convinced they're built to keep users single and spending.

articles.title: Small Towns Are Rising Up Against AI Data Centers
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being shoehorned into every corner of existence. Hyper scale data centers bring few benefits to communities, according to a report by the World Economic Forum (WEF).    .   "Data centers bring little benefit to communities".

articles.title: The great cognitive migration: How AI is reshaping human purpose, work and meaning
articles.author: Edelman
articles.summary: In the last two years, large language models (LLMs) have achieved a number of tasks that were reserved for professionals. People excel at tasks that are intuitive, emotional and deeply tied to embodied experience. In contrast, machines that can't reach these domains cannot reach human domains. People will need to migrate toward creativity, ethical reasoning, emotional connection and the weaving of deep meaning. The diffusion of AI technologies and its impact may take a decade or two.

articles.title: Why So Soon?
articles.author: Anonymous
articles.summary: ChatGPT gave him a list of the major events that happened in the last 5 years. Biden made a comeback in 2025 and things were looking good for his re-election. ChatGPT thinks we're not ready to integrate AI into everything so soon.

articles.title: â€˜Dangerous nonsense': AI-authored books about ADHD for sale on Amazon
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Amazon is selling books marketed at people seeking techniques to manage their ADHD that claim to offer expert advice yet appear to be authored by a chatbot such as ChatGPT. Amazon's marketplace has been deluged with AI-produced works that are frustrating and depressing.

articles.title: The great cognitive migration: How AI is reshaping human purpose, work and meaning
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: AI is reshaping the cognitive landscape faster than any technology before it. In the last two years, large language models (LLMs) have achieved PhD-level performance across many domains. As AI grows more capable, humans will need to embrace new domains of meaning and value. This cognitive migration will define the future of work, education and culture.

articles.title: Analyst who bought Palantir stock before a 600% rally updates price target
articles.author: Todd Campbell
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies' stock price is up 63% since May 2. Stephen Guilfoyle picked up shares in 2023 when they were about $16. Palantir closed a record number of deals worth $10 million or more in Q4. It produced $1.25 billion in adjusted free cash flow in 2024. AI's use cases seem boundless.

articles.title: How to Start NSFW AI Chat Without Filters by Crushon AI
articles.author: CRUSHON AI INC
articles.summary: Crushon AI is a web-based conversational AI platform that incorporates more than 17 leading language models (LLMs) and allows users to create their own AI characters. Crushon is a leading solution for adults who are looking for exclusive, customized, and intelligent AI chat services to include spicy chat AI.

articles.title: Wayne Dawson of Fox 8 Cleveland making return to television with special show
articles.author: Dan Kadar
articles.summary: Wayne Dawson has been absent from the airwaves for several months due to oral cancer treatment. Dawson will be the star of the new 30-minute show "Wayne's World" on Fox 8 CLE+. The show will air on Fox8 CLE+. You can watch it on Amazon Firestick, Apple TV and Roku. Dawson has battled prostate cancer and a series of mini-strokes.

articles.title: Wayne Dawson of Fox 8 Cleveland making return to television with special show
articles.author: Dan Kadar
articles.summary: Wayne Dawson has been absent from the airwaves for several months due to oral cancer treatment. He will be the star of the new 30-minute show "Wayne's World" on Fox 8 CLE+. The show will air on the station's streaming app. Dawson will be back on air soon.

articles.title: University in Ohio announces new AI degree program
articles.author: WHIO Staff
articles.summary: Bowling Green State University's Board of Trustees approved the Bachelor of Science in AI + X program on Friday. The degree program will teach students how to use AI in one of six specific fields of study: computer science, mathematics, physics, history, journalism or public relations. The Ohio Department of Higher Education needs to approve the program before it can be offered to students. The program will be housed in the Department of Computer Science.

articles.title: Ministry of Education introduces AI curriculum in public schools starting from 2025-2026 academic year
articles.author: Emirates 24/7
articles.summary: The Ministry of Education has announced integration of artificial intelligence as an official subject in the public-school curriculum for kindergarten to Grade 12 starting from the 2025-2026 academic year. The move will equip teachers with AI technology.   Â   Ã‚

articles.title: Lou Cartier: Ongoing exploration of AI's ethical boundaries
articles.author: The Tribune Greeley
articles.summary: It was only last month that Sam Altman released ChatGPT. Big Tech is upping the arms race in large language generative artificial intelligence models and it's only last week that Big Tech answered. For each new day there's a new development in this field.

articles.title: AI set to boost media and entertainment revenues by 10% while cutting costs by 15%: EY report
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) could increase revenues by 10% and reduce costs by 15% for media and entertainment companies in the medium term, according to a report by Ernst & Young. The report is titled 'A Studio Called India: Content and AI'.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO Admits We Have No Idea How AI Works
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei wants to create a robust "MRI on AI" within the next decade. He and his sister left OpenAI in late 2020 over concerns about the company's safety practices. They founded Anthropic the next year to work on building safer AI.

articles.title: Thread by @chrisramsay52 on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Chris Ramsay suggests that if he were seeding life across the galaxy, he would not send explorers or ambassadors. Instead he would place Mobile Construction Units, MCUs, at the bottom of the oceans. They would build, deploy, and maintain fleets of specialized craft designed for specific purposes.

articles.title: Florida teen wins Orlando Science Center competition using AI to simplify dementia diagnosis
articles.author: Jake Jordan
articles.summary: William Wakefield won first place at the 2025 Dr. Nelson Ying Science Competition at Orlando Science Center. His AI project, inspired by his grandfather's Alzheimer's-related death, simplifies dementia diagnosis to one brain scan with 95% accuracy. He received a $5,000 scholarship, $1,000 for his teacher and $1k for his school.

articles.title: US restaurant uses robots to make burgers, serves meal in 27 seconds
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: A new restaurant concept in Los Gatos, California, is using robots to precisely and quickly assemble meals. ABB's IRB 360 FlexPicker and YuMi collaborative robot work together in a self-contained burger-making cell to deliver made-to-order meals.

articles.title: The life-or-death case for self-driving cars
articles.author: Bryan Walsh
articles.summary: Waymo's self-driving cars had 81% fewer airbag-deploying crashes and 85% fewer crashes with suspected serious or worse injuries compared to human drivers. If the same 85% reduction in serious crashes held true for fatal ones, it would save approximately 34,000 lives a year.

articles.title: A worthy sequel to one of the best websites ever
articles.author: David Pierce
articles.summary: It's Finally Feels Like Summer Week at The Verge. This week's list includes a new companion to a great Mac app, the best Marvel movie in years, a new phone and new headphones to try, some weird AI and some good AI, the highest-tech planter you've ever seen, and much more.

articles.title: AI is just as overconfident and biased as humans can be, study shows
articles.author: Drew Turney
articles.summary: In almost half of the scenarios examined in a new study, ChatGPT exhibited many of the most common human decision-making biases. The study was published in the journal Manufacturing & Service Operations Management on April 8th. The authors tested OpenAI's GPT-3.5 and GPT 4 language models and found that they are not immune to human-like flaws.

articles.title: Therabot: Researchers develop AI tool to tackle mental therapist shortage
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: Dartmouth College researchers think AI can provide trustworthy psychotherapy, setting their work apart from the current psychotherapies. They need something different to meet this large need.   â€”Reuters.  in Hong Kong, China, June 25, 2023.

articles.title: EDITORIAL: Postpone Colorado's pending AI law; don't compound it
articles.author: The Gazette editorial board
articles.summary: Colorado's state lawmakers are running late bills through the process. Some of the bills are of little consequence, but some are big issues. One such measure is a haphazard effort to regulate the new and rapidly evolving technology of artificial intelligence. The version introduced late last week wasn't done right and if adopted as is, would pose dire policy implications. Last year's AI legislation was an overreach and almost guaranteed to hamstrung AI development when it went into effect on February 1st.

articles.title: Robots can knit clothes autonomously just by looking at fabric images
articles.author: Rupendra Brahambhatt
articles.summary: Researchers from Laurentian University developed an AI model that enables knitting robots to recreate fabric patterns just by analyzing an image. Their model achieved an accuracy of over 97% in converting images into knitting instructions, significantly outperforming existing methods. The researchers are planning to improve their deep-learning model so that it can be tested for more complex stitching tasks.

articles.title: The Sunday Morning Movie presents: The Strange Case of Senor Computer (2000) Run Time 1h 20m
articles.author: semper loquitur
articles.summary: Tom Sawyer's "The Strange Case of SeÃ±or Computer" is a low-budget indie comedy. It's simple but hilarious and deals with sophisticated questions about what it means to be a human being. The New York Times and filmthreat compared it favorably to Spielberg's "A.I."

articles.title: How to Use ChatGPT Without Being Annoying
articles.author: Jacob Clemente
articles.summary: Jacob Clemente and Jacob Clemente noticed a growing trend in professional circles of people sending ideas or documents for review with notes like 'here are some ideas from ChatGPT' or 'here's a draft I wrote with the help of ChatGpt'. What follows is often unedited or lightly edited text that's overly generic or missing important context. It shifts the cognitive burden from the creator to the recipient. It's not clear what the norms should be around using genAI for work.

articles.title: Viral images generated by ChatGPT in the style of Studio Ghibli's art highlight AI copyright concerns
articles.summary: ChatGPT allows users to create animated GIFs in the style of Studio Ghibli's founder Hayao Miyazaki using a new image generator tool. Miyazaki, 84, has expressed skepticism about AI's role in animation. ChatGPT maker OpenAI is fighting copyright lawsuits over its flagship chatbot.

articles.title: Trump posts AI image of himself as the pope
articles.author: Calhoun Times
articles.summary: President Donald Trump has posted an artificial intelligence-generated image of the president on Twitter. The image was created by an algorithm.   Ã‚   in the image is an image of President Donald Trump, created by artificial intelligence. It is of him.

articles.title: Hrithik Roshan, Shraddha Kapoor, Preity Zinta: How AI imagined these actors when they aged vs ...
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Fan edit video shows how artificial intelligence was far from accurate when it predicted what celebrities would look like when they reach a certain age. (Also "Power of Fitness and Diet" and "The Power of Fitness And Diet" by Michael Bamberger).

articles.title: Intimidated by AI? Here's How to Get Started
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: ChatGPT and other generative AI chatbots are useful tools for people who want to learn more about the technology. They can help people understand how AI is changing the world and give them some productivity hacks for their own lives. They are available in free accounts.

articles.title: Intimidated by AI? Here's How to Get Started
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: Generative AI is transforming every aspect of our lives, from high-school English to pharmaceutical discovery. OpenAI's ChatGPT was first on the scene and is the most well-known. Microsoft Copilot, powered by a mix of OpenAI and Microsoft tech, has an approachable interface for beginners. Google's Gemini brings search into the mix and can export data to Docs. Anthropic's Claude markets itself as 'safety-first' AI. There are many others including Meta AI and xAI's Grok.

articles.title: AI-driven farming crucial for Pakistan's climate resilience, food security : Experts
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Climate change is deeply affecting Pakistan, damaging crops, displacing communities and increasing uncertainty for farmers. With Artificial Intelligence (AI), we can give farmers a better life.   Â UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 4th May, 2025.

articles.title: 'AI is already here': Why some Connecticut school districts are embracing AI in the classroom
articles.author: Natasha Sokoloff
articles.summary: Connecticut educators gathered April 29 for the state Department of Education's AI in Education Leadership Summit to discuss the evolving role of artificial intelligence in the classroom. The state launched a pilot program this year in half a dozen districts to introduce state-approved AI tools into classroom instruction. East Hartford and Lebanon are among the districts testing out comprehensive AI usage in their classrooms.

articles.title: No need of Amitabh Bachchan or Shah Rukh Khan, AI will help create my star, Indian filmmaker Shekhar Kapur says
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Shekhar Kapur believes that artificial intelligence will allow him to create his own star instead of relying on superstars like Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh. He believes AI will have a positive impact on the movie industry in the future.

articles.title: Govt supports media, not just to improve press freedom ranking: Fahmi
articles.author: Malaysia Kini
articles.summary: Minister notes media industry facing multitude of challenges, including AI advancement, including challenges in the field of media technology.   Â   Ã‚   .   in the media industry is facing many challenges, such as AI advancement and competition from digital media.

articles.title: Let the car drive
articles.summary: The development and deployment of self-driving cars should be one of the U.S. government's highest priorities. John Slenska, Ben Avon, and others believe it will eliminate traffic stops, drunk driving, road accidents, and automobile insurance costs.

articles.title: Why some are betting on Pittsburgh to be an AI hub â€” and transform the region's economy
articles.author: Jimmy Cloutier
articles.summary: Pittsburgh is trying to attract AI companies to the region. It has top-tier universities and vast natural gas reserves to power data processing centers. It also has a small tech sector and growing AI industry. However, many companies started in Pittsburgh only to relocate or expand out of state. NIH terminated 10 research grants for the University of Pittsburgh valued at $16.2 million in March.

articles.title: AI Breakthrough: Metamorphic Video Powers Text-to-Video
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: MagicTime is an AI text-to-video model that learns real-world physics knowledge from time-lapse videos. It can be used to simulate not only biological metamorphosis but also buildings undergoing construction or bread baking in the oven. The researchers view it as an important step toward more sophisticated models.

articles.title: Deepfakes and impostors: the brave new world of AI jobseeking
articles.author: The Week UK
articles.summary: Hiring managers are having problems with AI in the recruitment process. Many companies use AI to generate job descriptions and screen candidates, but it's also being used to cheat the system. The embrace of AI is creating headaches for people on both sides. It's mostly a problem in the IT sector.

articles.title: US researchers seek to legitimize AI mental health care
articles.author: News Graphic
articles.summary: Researchers at Dartmouth College believe artificial intelligence can deliver reliable psychotherapy, distinguishing their work from the unproven and sometimes dubious mental health apps flooding today's market. They believe their work is distinguishable from those which are unproven or dubious in comparison.

articles.title: AI tools from Google, LinkedIn, and Salesforce could help you find your next job
articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.summary: Google's Career Dreamer is an AI-powered tool that helps people explore their next career path. LinkedIn's Next Role Explorer showcases potential opportunities within the company and suggests skills people should develop. Salesforce's Career Connect is an internal talent marketplace that uses AI to help employees create personalized career paths tailored to their skills.

articles.title: MSI Aegis Z2 Gaming PC Hits Lowest Price in 30 Days, Comes with DOOM
articles.author: Alfred Custodio
articles.summary: MSI Aegis Z2 is a 2025 gaming desktop with AMD and NVIDIA graphics cards. It has 32GB of RAM, a 1TB Gen4 NVMe SSD, and a 750W 80+ Gold power supply. It is currently discounted by $250.

articles.title: Disease stole his voice, but Elon Musk's technology returned it
articles.author: Lois M. Collins
articles.summary: Brad Smith, 44, has amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and he lost the ability to speak a few years ago. He is the third person to receive a Neuralink implant, which lets him speak with his computer, using his eyes to move the cursor to type words that are read aloud.

articles.title: AI therapy surprised me. But I won't be ditching my human therapist just yet
articles.author: Sam Delaney
articles.summary: A growing number of young people are turning to AI for therapy. Sam Delaney's AI therapist gave him good advice, asked relevant questions and managed to put him at ease. Sam's wife works in publishing and she thinks AI will crush creativity and culture, silence human voices and impact household income.

articles.title: AI-Run Company: The Predictable Failure
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: TheagentCompany was an experiment to test the capabilities of autonomous AI agents in a business environment. It failed because of the limitations of current AI technology. It also served as a reminder that autonomous systems are not the sentient, all-knowing artificial intelligence often depicted in science fiction.

articles.title: US researchers seek to legitimize AI mental health care
articles.author: Thomas URBAIN AFP
articles.summary: Researchers at Dartmouth College believe artificial intelligence can deliver reliable psychotherapy. Their application, Therabot, addresses the critical shortage of mental health professionals. According to Nick Jacobson, an assistant professor of data science and psychiatry, multiplying the current number of therapists tenfold would leave too few to meet demand.

articles.title: JIM 'PAPPY' MOORE: Do Your Part for AI
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) steals people's words without knowing the actual meaning. Jim 'Pappy' Moore advises people not to imitate AI in their communication. AI does not understand sarcasm and it doesn't get sarcasm. Jim and Pappy are playing golf next Thursday.

articles.title: White House AI-generated Donald Trump's Image Jedi: Everything we know so far
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The official White House X and Instagram accounts shared an AI-generated image of Donald Trump as a baby. It was created by an artificial intelligence. It is a picture of Trump as an infant.   Â   Ã‚   in the image.

articles.title: AI enters Delhi school curriculum on May 8
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Delhi schools will have the option of including modules on Artificial Intelligence for classes VI to X on May 8. The chapter is aimed for children aged 11 to 14 years. The programme is designed to demystify AI and help students understand its basic concepts and its role in various industries.

articles.title: AI-authored books about ADHD â€˜for sale on Amazon'
articles.author: AOL
articles.summary: Amazon has been accused of allowing AI-authored books about ADHD to be sold on its platform. The online marketplace has been targeted by those looking to sell cheap-to-publish books written by artificial intelligence, which can include unhelpful or dangerous misinformation.

articles.title: AI can significantly enrich journalism, despite emerging threats
articles.author: Ghana Business News
articles.summary: Albert Kwabena Dwumfour is the President of the Ghana Journalists. He believes the integration of Artificial Intelligence into journalistic practice holds immense potential to transform and enrich news gathering and dissemination processes, despite emerging challenges. GJA's theme is "Celebrating the Champions of Press Freedom and Ghana's Media Growth".

articles.title: UAE adds AI to school curriculum
articles.author: Arabian Business
articles.summary: The UAE will teach AI concepts as an official curriculum subject from kindergarten to Grade 12. It will be taught as a subject from the age of 1 to 12 years old.    for more information, visit: http://www.uah.gov.uk/ai/

articles.title: UAE to introduce AI as subject in school curriculum
articles.author: The Siasat Daily
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates will introduce Artificial Intelligence as a subject in public schools starting from the next academic year. The announcement was made on Sunday, 4 May, via X by Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE.

articles.title: Driving Innovation: Analyzing the Revolutionary Artificial Superintelligence Alliance
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: The Artificial Superintelligence Alliance is a groundbreaking collaboration at the intersection of AI and blockchain. It was created by Fetchai, SingularityNET, and Ocean Protocol. It aims to transform the way decentralized systems tackle artificial general intelligence by merging AI and the blockchain.

articles.title: How to Start NSFW AI Chat Without Filters by Crushon AI
articles.author: Nasdaq Globe Newswire
articles.summary: There is an increasing demand for adult-targeted artificial intelligence and there has also been a rise in demand for artificial intelligence for robots.   Â   Ã‚   in 2025.  in the future.  In 2025, in 2025 there will be no more robots without humans.

articles.title: Fully automated: Robots can knit clothes just by looking at fabric images
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: A team of researchers from Laurentian University has developed an AI model that enables knitting robots to recreate fabric patterns just by taking a photo of a sweater and instantly having a machine recreate it, stitch by stitch. The technology is close to becoming a reality, according to the researchers.

articles.title: Conference discusses role of AI in realising digital transition
articles.author: Oman Observer
articles.summary: The 7th edition of the Students Research Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Cybersecurity was held at the Middle East College in Muscat. It was held to discuss AI and cybersecurity issues. It is the first time the conference has been held in Oman.

articles.title: What is 'Gork' and how is it different from Elon Musk's AI platform 'Grok'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Elon Musk is the world's richest man and a tech enthusiast. His latest invention is an AI assistant and chatbot, Grok, developed by xAI, an artificial intelligence corporation founded by Musk. It has overtaken some of the popular technological creations such as X (formerly Twitter) and Tesla.

articles.title: Malta gets drones to spot litter â€“ Now can we get one to detect corruption?
articles.author: Independent Online
articles.summary: Malta's government has announced an AI-powered initiative to tackle public cleanliness. Prime Minister Robert Abela declared that artificial intelligence will soon be hunting down litter and there's "nothing to see here".   Â    .  .

articles.title: Dangerous nonsense- AI-authored books about ADHD for sale on Amazon - Artificial intelligence (AI)
articles.author: Jakarta News
articles.summary: There are AI-authored books about ADHD for sale on Amazon - Artificial intelligence (AI) - for sale. They are called "Dangerous Nonsense" and "Artificial Intelligence" books. They're written by AI-authors. They write about artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Radiology: Where AI makes up for manpower shortage
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: AI can help halve radiologists' reporting times, according to the study. It can help reduce the time it takes for a radiologist to report to the office, too. It could help reduce costs, too, if it's accurate and efficient.

articles.title: Google's Nudity Warnings Will Warn You of Incoming Explicit Images in Messages
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: The process happens on your device and Google doesn't have access to any images, so it has no access to the data at all. It's entirely controlled by the user's device and their device's screen.   Google says it doesn't access any images.

articles.title: AI adoption can increase revenue by 10%, reduce costs by 15% for media industry: EY
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Automated dubbing, AI-based subtitling and voice-recognition are among the new technologies available to filmmakers.  Itinerary.com is a provider of such technology. It offers a range of services, including voice recognition and automated dubbing.

articles.title: " Starting Next Year" ... UAE to Integrate AI into All Public Education Stages
articles.author: Yemen Online
articles.summary: The UAE government has announced the introduction of Artificial Intelligence as a subject across all educational levels, from kindergarten to grade 12, starting next academic year. This decision aligns with the National AI Strategy, which aims to promote the development of artificial intelligence in the UAE.

articles.title: UAE to launch AI curriculum starting in kindergarten: 7 core concepts revealed
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: The UAE Ministry of Education has announced the integration of Artificial Intelligence as a core subject across all public schools starting from the 2025â€“2026 academic year. The initiative aims to equip students from kindergarten to Grade 12 with essential AI knowledge and skills to thrive in an increasingly complex, tech-driven world.

articles.title: Join Forces: 70+ Crypto Companies Unite To Challenge Big Tech's AI Dominance
articles.author: MENA FN

articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: Researchers at Dartmouth College believe artificial intelligence can deliver reliable psychotherapy. Their application, Therabot, addresses the need for reliable mental health apps in the modern market.   Â    - AFP/File.  -   "We need to meet this large need"

articles.title: Anthropic CEO Admits We Have No Idea How AI Works
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei announced plans to create a robust MRI on AI within the next decade. The goal is not only to figure out how AI works, but also to make sure people are right to be concerned about it. He wrote it in an essay published to his website.

articles.title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta Claims NASA's Scientists Have Confirmed Sanskrit Is A â€˜Scientific' Language
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Her assertion was probably based on a 1985 paper, and glorification of it with little follow-up, published in AI magazine, which was most likely based on the 1985 paper. It was published with no follow up or further discussion. It is most likely a reference to that paper.

articles.title: Is AI the future of fitting or just a really smart assistant?

articles.summary: Machine learning and data-driven recommendations are buzzwords used in the golf industry. What does that mean for you, the golfer standing on the mat? GOLF Staff explains to you what it really means for you and your golfing equipment.

articles.title: The Impact Of Artificial Intelligence On Press Freedom And The Media
articles.author: Dr. Ewelina U. Ochab
articles.summary: On May 3, the international community marked World Press Freedom Day, a day designated by the United Nations to galvanize action to ensure and protect press freedom globally. Since January 2025, at least 20 people who work in the media have been killed and 80% of crimes against journalists go unpunished. The media are being used to spread misinformation and disinformation. The use of artificial intelligence (AI) is changing journalism, the media, and press freedom. Volker TÃ¼rk, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, warned against the concentration of power in the area of AI.

articles.title: As AI Use Soars, Companies Shift From SEO To GEO
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: According to Bain & Company study, 80% of consumers rely on AI summaries for at least 40% of their searches. Businesses without an AI visibility strategy are seeing double-digit traffic decreases from search engines. Digital agencies are offering "AI Readiness" audits and GEO services to help businesses adapt.

articles.title: No Plans Yet For AI Law, AIGE Currently In Use
articles.author: Malaysian National News Agency
articles.summary: There are no plans yet for AI law. AIGE is currently in use. Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Chang Lih Kang said that there are currently no plans for the AI law yet. The AIGe is currently being used by the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

articles.title: Google to give kids access to Gemini AI
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Gemini AI chatbot will help kids with school homework and read stories. Google advised parents to impose parental control on using the chatbot via Family Link parental controls. Google will allow kids to use their chatbot, Gemini AI, for homework and reading stories.

articles.summary: On Friday night, the 78-year-old president shared an AI-generated image depicting himself in full papal regalia. He is seen in the image as being in his late 80s or 90s and wearing a papal hat and a cassock.

articles.title: AI adoption for work safety faces challenges in Indonesia
articles.author: The Jakarta Post
articles.summary: Indonesia is lagging on infrastructure and training, as well as the implementation of basic work safety standards, according to ILO. Artificial intelligence may help in improving occupational safety and health, but adoption in Indonesia may be hindered as the country lags on training and infrastructure.

articles.title: AI tools from Google, LinkedIn, and Salesforce could help you find your next job
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: Sometimes, you need to change things up in your career. Increasingly, artificial intelligence is helping people explore their next steps, even if their current job isn't fulfilling anymore or circumstances are pushing them toward a new path.    .  .

articles.author: South China Morning Post

articles.title: ScienceOne AI platform to accelerate scientific breakthroughs
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: The Chinese Academy of Sciences unveiled ScienceOne, an artificial intelligence platform designed to transform how researchers tackle complex challenges in fundamental science fields such as mathematics, physics and biology. It was developed by CAS's Institute of Automation and streamlines how discoveries are made.

articles.title: Orange Cones and Squealing Tires: What Autocross is All About and How to Dominate Your Next Event
articles.author: Ryan Bahrke
articles.summary: Autocross is a motorsports discipline where competitors navigate a course marked by traffic cones in a paved area. Denver ophthalmologist Vivek Koduri moonlights as a local-favorite autocross instructor in his Porsche 981 Boxster GTS. Autocross favors handling over power and smaller and lighter cars often take the top spots.

articles.title: Big Bets On Which Of These Pathways Will Push Today's AI To Become Prized AGI
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: In today's column, I examine the most likely pathways to get us from today's contemporary AI to the vaunted AGI (artificial general intelligence). The general goal is to reach artificial general intelligence (AGI) or the outstretched possibility of achieving artificial superintelligence (ASI). We are currently mid-way through the year 2025. Some AI prognosticators believe simply incrementing AI each year is not the ticket to success.
